history.origin: Szkiet compared the little book illumination there is (one initial on f. 42v), which, according to her, shows no similarities with the decoration from Schaffhauser. Unclear where it was produced. Borst noted as place of production (without argumentation) St. Gall or Reichenau.
history.provenance: Cordoliani for the provenance - from the 13th c. attested in the library of Schaffhausen, based on a note on fol. 104 Anno domini MCCCLV in vigilia sancti Oswaldi regis accepi hunc librum de libraria nostra. Borst argued the manuscript was in Schaffhausen already around 1050, where it served as the "komputistische Grundausstattung". This, however, contradict with the note, unless the book left the monastery between 105 and 1355 and was brought once again 1355.
